guidebook@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: A new Skybedrock Guidebook can be obtained by using a book on a grass block.

end_stone@how_to_play.build_element.$text:
Dragon Heads can convert cobblestone to end stone.
- Push a piston towards a dragon head with dragon breath in it
- The head can be placed on the wall or the ground
- It needs to be facing a cardinal direction
- It needs to not have been powered by redstone before
- It needs an air gap in front of it
- It can receive dragon breath as a dropped item or from a hopper above

deepslate@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Sculk transforms into Deepslate when used in a Lava Cauldron, 10%% chance to consume one layer of Lava.

slime_finder@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
You can hit a Stone block with a Stone Shovel to find the nearest slime chunk.

It uses more durability the farthest away the chunk is.

budding_amethyst@how_to_play.feature_ele.$text:
Use a Nether Star on an Amethyst Block to convert it into Budding Amethyst, there is a 25%% chance for the Nether Star to break.
This only works in the overworld

coral_reefs@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
Coral can be bonemealed into large coral if:
- The coral is placed on top of sand or dirt
- The coral is alive and submerged in water
- There is no blocks in the area around the coral except water, bubble columns, sea grass, corals, and coral fans

spore_blossom@how_to_play.build_element.$text: Use Bone Meal on Rooted Dirt for a 10%% chance to grow a Spore Blossom.

recipe@how_to_play.axolotl_recipe.$text: Feeding Lucy Axolotls Copper Ingots --> 80%% chance to spit Raw Copper and 20%% chance to reject it.
Feeding Cyan Axolotls Iron Ingots --> 80%% chance to spit Raw Iron and 20%% chance to reject it.
Feeding Gold Axolotls Gold Ingots --> 80%% chance to spit Raw Gold and 20%% chance to reject it.
Feeding Wild Axolotls Netherite Scrap --> 80%% chance to spit Ancient Debris and 20%% chance to reject it.

disclaimer@assets.text_box.$text:
Added 7 Fake Ores to replace the vanilla ores that drop multiple items.

They look and act exactly like their vanilla counterparts.

Crafting recipes:

smelting_text@assets.text_box.$text: Fake Ores can be smelted just like regular Ores

mining_text@assets.text_box.$text: Fake Ores are not affected by Fortune.

suspicious_blocks@how_to_play.build_elem.$text:
- Suspicious Sand blocks in the Desert Temple regenerate every 30 minutes.
- Suspicious Sand blocks in the Desert Well regenerate every 15 minutes.
- Suspicious Sand blocks in the Warm Ocean Ruins regenerate every 35 minutes.
- Suspicious Gravel blocks in the Cold Ocean Ruins regenerate every 25 minutes.
- Suspicious Gravel blocks in the Trail Ruins regenerate between 60 to 80 minutes.

totem_note@assets.text_box.$text: > Deactivate§q More Cat Gifts§r in world settings of the guidebook to disable this feature

totem@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
If you feed a tamed cat that is sitting and sleep while it is making heart particles, it will give you a gift in the morning.
You can do that with as many cats as you want, make sure they don't breed to not lose the heart particles.
- Maximum range is 8 blocks from the bed.

totem_note@assets.text_box.$text: > Deactivate§q Totem of Unfalling§r in player settings of the guidebook to disable this feature

totem@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Totems of Undying save you from falling in the void.

disclaimer@assets.text_box.$text: * It's not possible to bring vanilla Structure Spawning Areas to a Flat world type, so these custom rules have to do for now *

swamp_hut@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
1) §u§lSwamp Hut:§r

- One Spawning Spot inside the Swamp Hut.
- One Witch tries to spawn every 0 to 2 seconds.
- Can spawn on most solid blocks with solid surface, except upside down Slabs and Stairs.
- Can Spawn inside most blocks with no collision, but not inside redstone components and light sources.
- The block at the head level can also be Glass, Tinted Glass, Glass Panes, Water, or Flawing Water.
- No mob is standing on the spawning spot.
- There is less than 2 Witches within 5 blocks of the spawning spot.
- Less than 16 hostile mobs loaded.
- There is a Player within 24 to 44 blocks away from the spawning spot.
- There is no Player less than 24 blocks away from the spawning spot.

outpost@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
2) §n§lPillager Outpost:§r

- 4 Spawning Spots in and around the Pillager Outpost.
- Every second, a spot is selected and a Pillager tries to spawn on it.
- Can spawn on most solid blocks with solid surface, except upside down Slabs and Stairs.
- Can Spawn inside most blocks with no collision, but not inside redstone components and light sources.
- The block at the head level can also be Glass, Tinted Glass, Glass Panes, Water, or Flawing Water.
- No Mob is standing on the spawning spot.
- There is less than 2 Pillagers within 5 blocks of the spawning spot.
- Less than 16 hostile mobs can be loaded.
- There is a Player within 24 to 44 blocks away from the spawning spot.
- There is no Player less than 24 blocks away from the spawning spot.

monument@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
3) §3§lOcean Monument:§r

- 22 Spawning Spots in the Ocean Monument.
- Every 4th of a second a random spot is selected and a Guardian tries to spawn on it.
- Spawns on most solid blocks with solid surface as well as Sea Lanterns, but not on Soul Sand, upside down Slabs and Stairs.
- Spawn inside Water or flowing water, but not inside Bubble Columns and Waterlogged blocks.
- The block above can be Water, Flowing Water, Air, Glass, and most blocks with no collision.
- No Mob is standing on the spawning spot.
- There is less than 2 Guardians within 5 blocks of the spawning spot.
- Less than 16 hostile mobs loaded.
- There is a Player within 24 to 44 blocks away from the spawning spot.
- There is no Player less than 24 blocks away from the spawning spot.

brutes@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Piglins on half a heart convert into Piglin Brutes if you feed them Golden Apples.

@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Guardians struck by Lightning convert into Elder Guardians.

sky_treasure@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
Use a Sky Treasure Map anywhere to locate the treasure location.
Use the map at the treasure location to obtain a sky treasure chest.

i@assets.selected_number.$text: 6 items of this group are selected.

chicken1@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: A Diamond Chicken has a 5%% chance to spawn instead of a normal Chicken.

chicken2@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Baby Chickens have a 1%% chance to grow up into Diamond Chickens.

chicken3@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
Diamond Chickens look exactly like normal Chickens but with a diamond feather on their left wing.

Diamond Chickens do not lay Eggs.

Diamond Chickens will lay a single Diamond after 3 hours of being loaded.

Diamond Chickens will convert back into normal egg laying Chickens after laying their Diamond.

end_phantoms1@how_to_play.feature_elemen.$text:
- End Phantoms spawn in the end dimension around players who haven't eaten anything but chorus fruits for a day (20 Minutes)
- The player must eat at least 16 chorus fruits.
- End phantoms need the gamerule doinsomnia to be turned on.
- End phantoms can also spawn naturally around the 2nd and 12th end gateways regardless of eating chorus fruits and doinsomnia.

end_phantoms2@how_to_play.feature_elemen.$text:
- Slightly smaller than regular phantoms
- They are living mobs
- They do not burn in day light
- Have glowing purple eyes

end_phantoms3@how_to_play.build_element.$text: End Phantoms drop phantom membrane and broken elytra

ender_eyes@how_to_play.feature_element.$text:
You may find up to 3 strongholds in the overworld.

Each stronghold will generate 1280 blocks away from spawn.

Use an eye of ender and follow the purple particles to locate the nearest stronghold.

Eyes of Ender have a 10%% chance to break when used.

spawner_core@assets.text_box.$text: Spawner Cores can be obtained from ominous trial spawners

text1@assets.text_box.$text:
Use 50 levels of XP and a common mob drop on an empty spawner in the right dimension.

Make sure there isn't any other active spawners within the spawner range:
- 8 blocks for Cave Spider Spawners.
- 16 blocks for Zombie, Skeleton, Spider, and Blaze Spawners.
- 32 blocks for Magma Cube Spawners.

breaking@assets.text_box.$text: Monster Spawners drop Empty Spawners when broken with a pickaxe.

trial_spawners@how_to_play.build_element.$text: Build the matching layout for the mob you want to create a spawner for, make sure you are in the overworld.

t2@assets.text_box.$text: Place an empty spawner in the middle.

t3@assets.text_box.$text: Use 20 XP levels and a Trial Key on the spawner to activate it.

breaking@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: The Mace can be used to turn Trial Spawners back into Emtpy Spawners

enderman_pickup_note@assets.text_box.$text: > Use §u/settings endermans_plus enable§r command to enable this feature

enderman_pickup@how_to_play.feature_elem.$text: Endermen can pick up Frosted Ice, Farmland, and Suspicious Blocks. To prevent water in the Nether, neither players nor endermen can place Frosted Ice in the Nether.

player_heads_note@assets.text_box.$text: > Use §u/settings player_heads enable§r command to enable this feature

layer_heads@how_to_play.build_element.$text: If a Player or an Armor Stand wearing a Zombie Head or a Skeleton Skull got struck by Lightning, the Zombie Head or Skeleton Skull will convert into a Player Head.

dragon_egg_note@assets.text_box.$text: > Use §u/settings dragon_eggs enable§r command to enable this feature

dragon_egg@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Dragon Egg can be summoned if you place 4 Netherite blocks on the End Fountain in the correct locations.

sculk_shriekers_note@assets.text_box.$text: > Use §u/settings natural_shriekers enable§r command to enable this feature

sculk_shriekers@how_to_play.feature_elem.$text: Sculk Shriekers placed by the player in the deep dark biome can spawn wardens.

no fortune@assets.text_box.$text: These ores are not affected by the Fortune enchantment

i@assets.skeleton_kill.$text: If killed by a Skeleton or Stray.

lush_caves_sniffer@how_to_play.sniffer_t.$note: Can search and dig in Clay

i@assets.selected_number.$text: 1 to 3 items of this group are selected.

terracotta@how_to_play.trading_feature.$details:
* Probability: 400%% (this trade occurs 4 times)
* Number of Trades: 16

ender_loader_image@how_to_play.feature_e.$text: Ender Pearls tick the 5 by 5 chunks around them.

axolotl_feed@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Baby Axolotls can be fed tropical fish rather than buckets of tropical fish to make them grow faster.

drowneds@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Up to 8 drowneds can spawn in dripstone caves and 8 at surface instead of 5 in caves only.

no_trader_llama@how_to_play.feature_elem.$text: Wandering traders will spawn without trader llamas.

zombie_horse@how_to_play.feature_element.$text: Zombies can attack and kill untamed Horses, if a Horse got killed by a Zombie, it will convert into a Zombie Horse.

detector@assets.text_box.$text:
* You can activate the biome detector in the player settings.
 
* You can find the player settings in the settings section of Skybedrock Guidebook.
 
* When active, it will display the biome in the chat stack.

paragraph7@assets.text_box.$text: * The Nether has normal biome generation with all blocks removed beyond 160 blocks away from 0,0 in any direction.

locator@assets.text_box.$text:
* Your render distance has been limited to 16 chunks.
 
* Complete the "On the Radar" achievement to unlock your render distance.
 
* Use the World Maps section of the guidebook access the structure maps.
 
* Complete Explorer Path achievements to unlock more structures.
 
* Complete "Distant Realm" to unlock  the nether structures map.
 
* Click any structure to activate the structure locator.
 
* The structure locator is a ui compass that points towards the selected structure.
 
* Click the toggle on the top right corner of the structures map to turn it off.

portals@assets.text_box.$text:
* Ruined Portals can be found randomly in the Nether.
 
* Nether Fortress Bounding Boxes can also be found randomly in the Nether.

border@assets.text_box.$text:
* The End dimension is completely voided of all blocks except for a few structures:

- §bThe Obsidian Platform§r: Where you spawn when you enter the end dimension.

- §bThe Ender Dragon Arena§r: Made of a large circle of 3 layers of end stone, the end fountain in the middle, and 10 end crytals around it.

- §b20 Small End Islands§r: One for each end gateway.

- §b5 End City Islands§r: Near the 1st, 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th end gateways.

- §b3 Chorus Plant Islands§r: Near the 1st, 9th, and 18th end gateways.

- §b2 End Phantom Spawning Areas§r: Around the 2nd and 12th end gateways.

- §bReturn End Gateways§r: Generate randomly in the far end.

inform@assets.text_box.$text:
§o§7%command.inform.description§r

Cheats: §aNot required§r
Operator: §aNot required§r

§pSyntax:§r /inform [information] [player] [location]

§vParameters:§r
- information: §g[biome | slimechunk]§r  §7(If omitted, it will show you the command usage§7)§r
- player: A player target selector  §7(Defaults to §e@s§7)§r
- location: A set of coordinates  §7(Defaults to §e~ ~ ~§7)§r

recover@assets.text_box.$text:
§o§7%command.recover.description§r

Cheats: §aNot required§r
Operator: §aNot required§r

§pSyntax:§r /recover [item]

§vParameters:§r
- item: §g[bucket | lava | water | sapling | portal | grass | guidebook]

settings@assets.text_box.$text:
§o§7%command.settings.description§r

Cheats: §aNot required§r
Operator: §cRequired§r

§pSyntax:§r /settings [setting] [action]

§vParameters:§r
- setting: The feature Id §7(Leave empty to see a list of the available feature Ids§r
- action:
  §genable:§r Enables the feature
  §gdisable:§r Disables the feature
  §gquery:§r Tells you if the feature is on or off
  §ghelp:§r Explains the feature

ach@assets.text_box.$text:
§o§7%command.ach.description§r

Cheats: §cRequired§r
Operator: §cRequired§r

§pSyntax:§r /ach [action] [player] [quest_id]

§vParameters:§r
- action: §g[grant | revoke]§r
- player: A player target selector
- quest_id: The identifier of the quest

visit@assets.text_box.$text:
§o§7%command.assets.description§r

Cheats: §cRequired§r
Operator: §cRequired§r

§pSyntax:§r /visit [destination] [player]

§vParameters:§r
- destination: The identifier of the island or the structure
- player: A player target selector  §7(Defaults to §e@s§7)

restore@assets.text_box.$text:
§o§7%command.restore.description§r

Cheats: §cRequired§r
Operator: §cRequired§r

§pSyntax:§r /restore [structure]

§vParameters:§r
- structure: The identifier of the island or the structure
